H0.text: Supporting body posture is one function of the nervous system, which consists of the brain, spinal cord, and nerves that run throughout the entire body.

H1.text: Controls body functions is one function of the nervous system, which consists of the brain, spinal cord, and nerves that run throughout the entire body.

H2.text: Supplies the blood with oxygen is one function of the nervous system, which consists of the brain, spinal cord, and nerves that run throughout the entire body.

H3.text: Carries blood to and from the heart is one function of the nervous system, which consists of the brain, spinal cord, and nerves that run throughout the entire body.

A4.text: The primary function of the nervous system is to control the body. It does this by extracting information from the environment using sensory receptors, sending signals that encode this information into the central nervous system, processing the information to determine an appropriate response, and sending output signals to muscles or glands to activate the response.
